org.placeName: Ninth Judicial Circuit. Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: Circuit Court of the United States
Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of Joseph Walton on Habeas Corpus Writ of Habeas Corpus and Return Thereto
Filed on return, this 12 day of Jan. 1906 A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk. By A. N. Moore, Deputy Clerk.
In the Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth Judicial Circuit Western District of Washington. Northen Division
In the Matter of Joseph Walton on Habeas Corpus. No. 1376.
The President of the United States of America, to L.C. Smith, Sheriff of King County, Washington

Greeting: You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of Joseph Walton by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, Western District of Washington on the 11th day of January 1906, at 10 o'clock A. M. to do and receive what shall then be considered in the premises. And have you then and there this Writ.

Witness, the Honorable, Melville W. Fuller, Cheif Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and the seal of said Circuit Court, this 10th day of January in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hudnred and six, and of our Independence the 130th, A. Reeves Ayres. Clerk. By A. N. Moore. Deputy Clerk.
In obedience to the within Writ, I hereby certify that I served the same on L.C. Smith, sheriff of King County Wash.
